content.description: Starting in a short right facing corner then choose one of three cracks that takes you to a small roof hand crack. Finishes with a "friendly" finger crack.   Pulling the roof is probably the mental and physical crux. The fingers at the top is the technical crux.    An Awesome crack climb that has good gear placements!
content.location: The obvious splitter ten feet right-SW- of the pillar on the tallest part of Old Wall.   Walk off

content.description: This another tier of Raspberry Rocks- one of many gullies that run parrellel to each other    This wall faces westerly and runs SW-NE direction.    Located in the first gully east of The Weather Watchers Wall   This area sees very little traffic- highly likely you will have the entire wall to yourself.   Good rock -fun climbs -shorter climbs than Weather Watchers Wall
